description: Originally named "gray sulphuret of copper in dodecahedral crystals" in 1817 by mineralogist James Sowerby.
Renamed in 1819 by William Phillips in honour of Smithson Tennant (1761-1815), an English chemist who discovered the elements iridium and osmium.

entries.meaning: (mineralogy) A sulfide mineral of iron, copper and arsenic that is an ore of copper
